main event: On May 7, 1956 in Canton, Springfield, Ohio, a civilian and Air Force personnel observed a round object drifting slowly to the North for twenty minutes.
interesting points: The object was described to be the size of a half dollar held at arms length, moving very slowly with no sound.
The report concludes that due to the drifting duration and time of day, the sighting was probably generated by a balloon.
The altitude of the object was reported to be 15,323 feet.
The observers noted that the night was clear with winds at 0-5 mph and a temperature of 50 degrees Fahrenheit.
Despite being classified as a UFO sighting, the report suggests possible prosaic explanations such as a balloon or aircraft.
sighted object: one round object drifting very slowly
